title: >>> "Soccer SUCKS!"
body_text:
MARZARELLA and LEWIS vs. BASISTA and SMALLS
*
Their historic clashes from Seasons 9 and 10 were the perfect indication that this 103rd event would truly go down in the record books as one of the all-time greats.
The crazy, reckless dodging icon Sascha Basista was out to duplicate his triuphant victory from
DODGEBALL NINETY 4
. Add in two gutsy, fearless all-stars in the colorful Joey Smalls and the big, bad Gerald "G-Money" Lewis and there's no telling what to expect.
And one thing is for sure, no one could have predicted this eventual decimation ...
Basista/Smalls winning rounds
: 2, 6
Marzarella/Lewis winning rounds
: 1, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11
Not quite an infamous
Slaughter Victory
, but damn close. The tenacious Team
PondScum
ran with this one by a score of 9 to 2.
Moments & Stars
: The first rimshot during Game 6 by the incomparable Chris Adams; the absolutely vicious face/neck shot on the sidelined Sascha Basista delivered by the powerful John Tronolone; the ongoing feud between Rob Avakian and Juan Londono; the entire-team onslaught on Kevin Megill during Game 9; the rush of people watching Game 11, capped by an amazing performance by Kevin Adams
RECORDS
> Attendance: 23
> Notable Returns: Steve Kass (last appearance at DODGEBALL 84); Matt Larsen (last appearance at DODGEBALL 92)
> New Players: (1) Anthony Silverman
- This was the 15th straight event played on the back courts of the famed Wall High School.
- *DODGEBALL 103 was originally scheduled to feature a three-versus-three encounter. Hours before the event however, Dan Turner notified the writer of his absence.
- DODGEBALL 103 and the preceding DODGEBALL 102: TYA are first consecutive events to feature a standard two-versus-two team attraction.
- DODGEBALL 103 witnessed an incredible 11 games total; the highest number of completed games (excluding DODGEBALL 100) since DODGEBALL 88 in late-May.
- Records following DODGEBALL 103 ... Marzarella 2-2-2, Lewis 1-1-1, Basista 2-2-1, Smalls 1-2-0.
- An interesting note regarding this team war is that the partners themselves have been opponents on more than one occasion:
Marzarella vs. Lewis
(XXV);
Marzarella vs. Lewis vs. Turner vs. Hirschklau
(LX3);
Basista vs. Smalls
(LXV);
Basista vs. Smalls II
(74).
________________________________________
__________________
The adrenaline-pumping, high-octane Toms River Tournament is on the prowl. What does that mean for the competitors at DODGEBALL 104?
________________________________________
__________________
DOVER Taken OVER 2: September 22
Two legendary teams head into one of the biggest battles of the year. The 2nd state-wide tournament of its kind - who's coming out on top?
DODGEBALL 105: September 29
Two of the most dominant entities to ever compete finally go at it in their long-awaited return match from DODGEBALL 70!
Chris Adams
takes on
Kevin Fitzpatrick
with
CREAMation Rules
in effect!
DODGEBALL 106: October 6
The magical DODGEBALL 96 comes back to life in this 106th extravaganza. Can
Rob Avakian
make it two-straight against nemesis
Juan Londono
?
DODGEBALL 107: October 13
Has the road ended for Team ALL?
WALL v. ALL 3
.
DODGEBALL 108: October 20
(Match currently in the works)
DODGEBALL 109: October 27
A loud-mouthed court general who's done it all. A superstar bound for ultimate glory yearning for that big moment. Icon
Justin Pierce
meets sensation
Grant Cornero
in the first of two main events on the
The Road to 110
.
(Subject to Change)
DODGEBALL 110: November 3
Never say never. (Announcement coming in the next couple of weeks.)
body_html:
MARZARELLA and LEWIS vs. BASISTA and SMALLS*
Their historic clashes from Seasons 9 and 10 were the perfect indication that this 103rd event would truly go down in the record books as one of the all-time greats.

The crazy, reckless dodging icon Sascha Basista was out to duplicate his triuphant victory from DODGEBALL NINETY 4. Add in two gutsy, fearless all-stars in the colorful Joey Smalls and the big, bad Gerald "G-Money" Lewis and there's no telling what to expect.

And one thing is for sure, no one could have predicted this eventual decimation ...
Basista/Smalls winning rounds: 2, 6
Marzarella/Lewis winning rounds: 1, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11

Not quite an infamous Slaughter Victory, but damn close. The tenacious Team PondScum ran with this one by a score of 9 to 2.

Moments & Stars: The first rimshot during Game 6 by the incomparable Chris Adams; the absolutely vicious face/neck shot on the sidelined Sascha Basista delivered by the powerful John Tronolone; the ongoing feud between Rob Avakian and Juan Londono; the entire-team onslaught on Kevin Megill during Game 9; the rush of people watching Game 11, capped by an amazing performance by Kevin Adams

RECORDS
> Attendance: 23
> Notable Returns: Steve Kass (last appearance at DODGEBALL 84); Matt Larsen (last appearance at DODGEBALL 92)
> New Players: (1) Anthony Silverman

- This was the 15th straight event played on the back courts of the famed Wall High School.
- *DODGEBALL 103 was originally scheduled to feature a three-versus-three encounter. Hours before the event however, Dan Turner notified the writer of his absence.
- DODGEBALL 103 and the preceding DODGEBALL 102: TYA are first consecutive events to feature a standard two-versus-two team attraction.
- DODGEBALL 103 witnessed an incredible 11 games total; the highest number of completed games (excluding DODGEBALL 100) since DODGEBALL 88 in late-May.
- Records following DODGEBALL 103 ... Marzarella 2-2-2, Lewis 1-1-1, Basista 2-2-1, Smalls 1-2-0.
- An interesting note regarding this team war is that the partners themselves have been opponents on more than one occasion: Marzarella vs. Lewis (XXV); Marzarella vs. Lewis vs. Turner vs. Hirschklau (LX3); Basista vs. Smalls (LXV); Basista vs. Smalls II (74).
__________________________________________________________


The adrenaline-pumping, high-octane Toms River Tournament is on the prowl. What does that mean for the competitors at DODGEBALL 104?
__________________________________________________________

DOVER Taken OVER 2: September 22
Two legendary teams head into one of the biggest battles of the year. The 2nd state-wide tournament of its kind - who's coming out on top?

DODGEBALL 105: September 29
Two of the most dominant entities to ever compete finally go at it in their long-awaited return match from DODGEBALL 70! Chris Adams takes on Kevin Fitzpatrick with CREAMation Rules in effect!

DODGEBALL 106: October 6
The magical DODGEBALL 96 comes back to life in this 106th extravaganza. Can Rob Avakian make it two-straight against nemesis Juan Londono?

DODGEBALL 107: October 13
Has the road ended for Team ALL? WALL v. ALL 3.

DODGEBALL 108: October 20
(Match currently in the works)

DODGEBALL 109: October 27
A loud-mouthed court general who's done it all. A superstar bound for ultimate glory yearning for that big moment. Icon Justin Pierce meets sensation Grant Cornero in the first of two main events on the The Road to 110. (Subject to Change)

DODGEBALL 110: November 3
Never say never. (Announcement coming in the next couple of weeks.)
